ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Different parts of a mechanical system, manufacturing, design

Different manufacturing techniques. Various matlab technical skills from creating mechanical models computationally to creating calculators to facilitate structural calculations. Learned how to machine a cool and useful vice. Learned how to spec out a motor and how to design a powertrain.
How to create and evaluate mechanical designs, manufacturing processes. Design and prototyping skills: Matlab, Solidworks, machining, 3D printing
I learned about the various parts of the design process and how to perform analysis on different elements of a mechanical system.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I learned a lot, but it is a bit disorganized.

This course has great content but maybe a bit too much. It changes topics too quickly yet still demands a deep understanding of concepts. There is also a lot of machining of parts. Time management among the students was hard because too much trust/ power was placed on the students to manage large projects (unless this was a lesson in it of itself).

This course is cool because it takes concepts from other classes (mostly Strength & Deformation) and applies them to real things. The lectures were all great. I liked being able to actually build something for the final project. The main weakness of this course was the lack of feedback and general chaotic nature of the design assignments. I basically had no idea what I was doing for most of the semester and didn't receive a ton of guidance, which made me feel quite alone. I think if the ULAs had in-person office hours and there were more opportunities for collaboration, that would have helped. Also I don't know what it was about the Matlab assignments because conceptually they weren't that hard to grasp, but they made me want to pull my hair out.

One strength of the class was that we would learn about an element of a design in class, practice coding or a problem for homework, and also design that part of the final project.  This was helpful in gaining understanding and being able to apply it to our final project in chunks as the semester continued. One weakness of the course was the amount of work which made it difficult to keep up. The due dates were always accommodated so that we could finish and it was always just about getting the work done, but trying to keep up made the class a bit stressful at times.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 100% Yes it was a pleasure to take the class. Everything I was introduced to was fun learning unfortunately at times I felt overwhelmed but overall I earned so much from this class. I highly recommend all that are interested in MECH-E and have a strong theoretical or practical background to take the class.

Please do not take this because it is "the class where you get a free 3D printer." This class is a lot of work and you only sometimes feel rewarded for your efforts. But if you want to learn some useful engineering skills and feel empowered as a maker, I'd say this is a great class.
